thread.section_title: Club Quarters Hotel, opposite Rockefeller Center - UPDATED 2017 Reviews & Price Comparison (New York City) - TripAdvisor
thread.title: Noisy and run-down
thread.title_full: Noisy and run-down - Review of Club Quarters Hotel, opposite Rockefeller Center, New York City, NY - TripAdvisor

author: Pro-Flyer
title: Noisy and run-down
text:
Oh dear, my heart sank when I opened the door. Not a very welcoming hall. It was a sign of things to come.
My first room had cables dangling out a cupboard and was on the second floor above the road. There was apparently only alternative left when I checked in. Another room on the second floor overlooking the street, but no dangling cables. Hurray.
This was a superior room. Who would have thought. The noise from the street with the window closed was very bad. I heard every cart, motorbike and coach going by. Not to mention the sirens. Sleep was hard to come by.
Changed rooms again, this time *downgraded* to a Club room. It's slightly quieter, but the huge A/C unit on the low roof next door does not help.
The entire place is run down. Just check out the picture of the chair in my room with its stained and ripped cover. It says it all.
Only good thing: staff is not bad and the bed surprisingly comfortable
Room Tip: Away from the street if you want to sleep See more room tips
